pageContext.claim: “The JCPOA was a bad deal. Should not have been entered into. A lot of things could have happened that would have been much different. They're allowed to test ballistic missiles. You're not allowed to go various sites to check, and some of those sites are the most obvious sites for the creation or the making of nuclear weapons.”
pageContext.analysis: This is misleading as Iran at the time of the JCPOA had committed itself to ratifying the International Atomic Energy Agency’s Additional Protocol in 2023, which grants international inspectors wide latitude to inspect nuclear sites.
